data.title: Helicopters return to different helipads after empty ammo
data.body:
When helicopters empty their ammo, they automatically return to helipads. But these are different than the ones they return to when f is pressed. So if f is pressed while they're reloading after automatic return, they lift off and try to land on different helipads but they block each other and can't land. See issue #5709.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/2772152-helicopters-return-to-different-helipads-after-empty-ammo?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: TD crashes on bleed
data.body:
Mod crashes during loading.

Git bisect suggests 8249012e4b6cf7b405a1cbc2ee27b4f1c595b824 as the commit that introduced the problem though I can't immediately see why.

Last time I got a trace like this it was because I'd borked the project files and content wasn't getting copied to the right output directories. Hope that helps.

```
Tiberian Dawn Mod at Version {DEV_VERSION}
Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.1.7601 Service Pack 1)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 4.0.30319.18444
Exception of type `System.InvalidOperationException`: Sequence contains no matching element

   at OpenRA.World.CreateActor(String name, TypeDictionary initDict)
   at OpenRA.Mods.RA.SpawnMapActors.WorldLoaded(World world, WorldRenderer wr)
   at OpenRA.World.LoadComplete(WorldRenderer wr)
   at OpenRA.Game.StartGame(String mapUID, Boolean isShellmap)

   at OpenRA.Game.Initialize(Arguments args)
   at OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args)
   at OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args)
```

data.title: Make close spawn points distinguishable
data.body:
On some maps where multiple spawn points are located close to each other, they overlap and the letters cannot be seen. When mouse cursor hovers over them there could be something like a tooltip where spawns are shown clearly.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/2770703-make-close-spawn-points-distinguishable?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Also show team numbers in spawn points on minimap
data.body: In big maps with lots of players, it is often hard to figure out if everyone has selected correct teams and spots. If team numbers were also shown inside spawn points it would make this easier to see. So instead of only showing A for example, it could show A1.

data.title: Added the MAD Tank cracks
data.body: Made by @x-a-n-a-x. Attached to https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/4127. This is how they look in-game. The ZOffset seems to be ignored by the game though. Also the file size is very big because of https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/5295 so this needs re-compression.

data.title: Fix debug info regression from #5673
data.body: Mailaender pointed out in IRC that debug info for the Game project got accidentally removed in #5673. So I'm just adding it back in.

data.title: Release sheet buffers
data.body:
Sheets carry a managed buffer of data that allows updates to be made without having to constantly fetch and set data to the texture memory of the video card. This is useful for things like SheetBuilder which make small progressive changes to sheets.

However these buffers are often large and are kept alive because sheets are referenced by the sprites that use them. If this buffer is explicitly null'ed when it is no longer needed then the GC can reclaim it. Sometimes a buffer need not even be created because the object using the sheet only works on the texture directly anyway.

In practise, this reduced memory consumed by such buffers from ~165 MiB to ~112 MiB (at the start of a new RA skirmish mission).

In detail, at the start of the RA skirmish mission buffers still allocated were created by:
MapCache (16m)
SpriteFont (16m)
VoxelLoader (16m)
SequenceCache \* 4 (16m) (one per tileset)

112 MiB.

Buffers that had been released:
SeqeunceCache \* 2 (16m) (I think two tilesets overflowed and needed new textures so these ones were able to be freed)
CursorProvider (16m)
Theatre (1024k)
Something From File (2048k)
Something From File (1024k)
Something From File (512k)
Something From File (256k)
Something From File (64k)
RadarWidget \* 4 (16k)

53 MiB freed up compared to before where these buffers were being kept around despite not being needed.

I didn't bother checking what the stuff loaded by files had come from, I just know it was some files.

data.title: Fix FlyAttack discarding the activity queue upon completion
data.body:
This fixes a long-standing pet peeve of mine and makes aircraft finally fully scriptable without workarounds.

This pr also removes said workaround from the intervention mission, and also fixes another small issue the map had, which doesn't really deserve its own pr.

data.title: Move output to the "./bin/" directory
data.body:
This changes the project files and the build scripts output directory to a new "bin" directory instead of the tree root.

Notes:
- Needs testing on platforms other than Linux
- Needs testing with packaging and installation on all platforms
- I'd like to make a few more changes, like creating a "data" directory and moving the .ttf and GeoIP files there.
- Maybe create a "scripts" directory for the Linux launch scripts
- Maybe do the same for the generated docs (make docs)

See also #5457

data.title: Auto take off helis can't be repaired with mechanic
data.body: Before this release you could place a mechanic near helipads and he would repair helicopters when they come to reload. Now they take off automatically and don't stay on helipad, so they can't be repaired. Helis taking off by themselves is a good thing but it would be great if there was also a way to make them stay there.

data.title: Make construction yard a buildable structure
data.body: In addition to MCV, this would make it possible to just place another construction yard.

data.title: Remove beacon focus animation from radar map
data.body: When the game is slow due to lag, this animation takes too long to show the location of the beacon. It would be better if the rotating small triangle was shown immediately.

data.title: Added a new OpenRA.Lint check for invalid player definitions
data.body: Inspired by the findings of https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/5674 and https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/5703.

data.body:
Except the "preselected" replay (first one), I can't select any other replays and use the filter option.

data.title: Countdown before game start
data.body:
Could there be small delay before the game stats?

Currently i dont have the time to move my mouse over my MCV so i could deploy it as quickly as possible.

2 seconds delay at beginning would be enough. Now it starts kind of without warning.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/2768036-countdown-before-game-start?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Mapyamls updated
data.body: Same like #5674 .

data.title: Fixed exploding harvesters spawning resources on full cells
data.body: crashing the game as experienced in #5699.

data.title: Add /crash dev command
data.body: Throws an exception and crashes the game. Useful to test the shutdown sequence.

data.title: Fixes #5699
data.body: It's either this or change random Next() to silently ignore incorrect arguments.

data.title: Added the sonar pulse to reveal sub marines
data.body: As described in #4729 this was never implemented. Balancing wise I decided to make this a localized but multi-shot event similar to the spy plane. A good test case is http://resource.openra.net/maps/495/ which has creeps with an infiltratable sub pen and a submarine next to it plus soldiers that can be used as a disguise against the pillboxes.

data.title: Added a classic minelay order
data.body: This adds the classic single mine lay operation mode, but with OpenRA convenience: it will auto-reload at the repair bay.

data.title: Finished EmitCargoOnSell
data.body: The broken Lint check is still a problem after all those years. This also does not work as suggested in the empty trait. During selling it destroys the cargo so you can't just queue an Unload activity. You can't even enumerate through all passengers without hitting crashes. However, unloading just the first passenger is good enough for Red Alert's single-manned pillboxes.

data.title: Added the possibility for paratroopers to die on impact
data.body: as proposed in #5493. `LandOnlyInSuitableCell = false` is useful for testing purposes, but may be annoying for the players loosing their careless paratroopers so I made this an option we can simply disable later.

data.title: Hovering mouse over player start positions doesnt work anymore?
data.body:
I used to check teams by hovering mouse over the player positions.

Now it doesnt seem to work at all?

Could we get it to work again?

data.title: Change the Fast Forward icon in the Replay Viewer
data.body:
To me, the current one looks more like a "Next Track" (for a media player) icon rather than a Fast Forward icon.
![fastforward](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1732773/3349016/558cf6c2-f94e-11e3-862c-e9cc87baeabd.png)

Other players like pav256, pizzaoverhead also noticed it:
http://logs.ihptru.net/?year=2014&month=02&day=24#10:57:55

data.title: Fix size of force-start lobby dialogs. Fixes #5681.
Let engineers capture team-mates buildings
data.body:
Related to https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/5739 but not the same. That's why I split issues.

Now that I am thinking of this idea, there can probably be an easier way (rather than adding a new button at the top). 

Why not simply adding a new check-box in game options and cheats, to let team-mates capture your own buildings with the engineer? This way, it would do the same thing as Microbit's idea, and as an option, it would up to the game admin to decide to enable it or not.

![options](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1732773/3348576/fa240fda-f936-11e3-9b5d-7c55a80aaa93.png)

![cheats](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1732773/3348578/fd17bffc-f936-11e3-850e-44b486fc4db0.png)

data.title: Fix breakage of old Lua api. Fixes #5686.
data.body: introduced by #5305.

data.title: Added missing DomainIndex to Tiberian Sun
data.body:
Fixes the crash

```
Exception of type `System.InvalidOperationException`: Actor does not have trait of type `OpenRA.Mods.RA.DomainIndex`
```

when building units.
